harmony.physicalSubstrateObject: Apple iMac computer monitor with silver bezel and black screen

harmony.explanation: Large, flat, vertical glass closely matches the size/orientation of a canvas, making it easy to register contact exactly when the virtual brush meets the visual canvas.

harmony.expectedHapticFeedback: As the marker glides across the paper, the user feels steady, consistent drag - a smooth but noticeable resistance that provides tactile confirmation the marker is making contact.
harmony.explanation: Shaft gives long path but is cylindrical and can roll; maintaining steady rim-on-fabric contact is moderately difficult.

expressivity.explanation: Smooth rigid glass gives almost no push-back; friction is low and uniform, so stroke speed or force changes are barely felt.

realism.physicalSubstrateObject: Apple iMac computer monitor with silver bezel and black screen
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen halfway down its barrel with a writing grip and make light strokes over the desk surface
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Swivel the monitor so its glass front faces you upright at chest height, keep it powered off, and glide the pen tip lightly across the center area of the glass.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: The glass panel is perfectly rigid and slick with almost no texture, so strokes feel like skating on ice rather than dragging sable bristles over taut canvas. Orientation is correct and area is large, but the absence of progressive resistance and tooth yields a very poor paint-on-canvas impression.

realism.physicalSubstrateObject: small white tabletop fan with round grill
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen halfway down its barrel with a writing grip and make light strokes over the desk surface

realism.expectedHapticFeedback: Oil paint on a large size canvas with a paint brush. With gentle pressure, the resistance increases smoothly with a subtle pushback sensation
realism.explanation: The wire grill produces intermittent rattling contacts and gaps, nothing like the continuous smooth drag of bristles. Wire stiffness and discontinuity actively contradict the expected steady, slightly resistive glide.

realism.physicalSubstrateObject: compact black mechanical keyboard with grey keycaps and one orange key

realism.physicalSubstrateObject: white wireless Apple Magic Mouse

realism.explanation: Extremely narrow cylinder yields line contact; canvas-like broad gliding is impossible.

realism.physicalSubstrateObject: Apple iMac computer monitor with silver bezel and black screen
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen near its writing tip with a tripod grip and move the wrist to sketch on an imaginary surface.
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Leave the monitor exactly where it is and glide the pen tip lightly against the lower-center portion of the glass screen while it stands upright.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: As the marker glides across the paper, the user feels steady, consistent drag - a smooth but noticeable resistance that provides tactile confirmation the marker is making contact.
realism.explanation: The vertical glass screen is extremely slick and offers almost no drag; the orientation and hardness feel unlike horizontal paper, so only slight tactile contact is felt.

realism.physicalSubstrateObject: small white tabletop fan with round grill
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen near its writing tip with a tripod grip and move the wrist to sketch on an imaginary surface.

realism.expectedHapticFeedback: As the marker glides across the paper, the user feels steady, consistent drag - a smooth but noticeable resistance that provides tactile confirmation the marker is making contact.
realism.explanation: Horizontal plastic base is smoother than paper but at least gives a stable flat plane; light drag is present yet still feels more slippery than paper.

realism.physicalSubstrateObject: compact black mechanical keyboard with grey keycaps and one orange key
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Hold the pen near its writing tip with a tripod grip and move the wrist to sketch on an imaginary surface.

realism.explanation: Matte ABS underside has modest friction closer to copy paper; flat area is adequate, but slight texture variations and limited size reduce full realism.

realism.physicalSubstrateObject: Apple iMac computer monitor with silver bezel and black screen
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the rim at one point with a precision tripod grip and move the hand as though writing.

realism.explanation: The monitor’s glass is extremely smooth and low-friction; the thin plastic rim slides almost friction-lessly, giving little of the steady drag felt when a marker tip bites paper. Visually the size match is acceptable, but haptically the combination feels too slick and rigid.

realism.physicalSubstrateObject: small white tabletop fan with round grill

realism.explanation: The base’s painted plastic offers slightly more resistance than glass but is still quite slick; the raised pole interrupts strokes, and the curved edge limits continuous motion. Provides only light drag, so realism is weak but not entirely absent.

realism.physicalSubstrateObject: compact black mechanical keyboard with grey keycaps and one orange key

realism.explanation: Keycap ABS plastic has a satin texture that gives modest drag, but the edge is narrow and stepped; movement is jerky and uneven compared with continuous strokes on paper. Provides some tactile confirmation but lacks the uniform glide.

realism.physicalSubstrateObject: black and white patterned umbrella with curved handle
realism.contactUtilizationMethod: Grip the rim at one point with a precision tripod grip and move the hand as though writing.
realism.substrateUtilizationMethod: Keep the umbrella closed; lay the fabric-covered shaft horizontally; slide the cup rim along the smooth patterned canopy surface.
realism.expectedHapticFeedback: As the marker glides across the paper, the user feels steady, consistent drag - a smooth but noticeable resistance that provides tactile confirmation the marker is making contact.
realism.explanation: Tightly wrapped nylon fabric has a subtle weave that imparts moderate, even drag reminiscent of writing on slightly glossy paper. Cylinder shape reduces contact area, but overall feel is closer to expected than many other pairs.
